result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Oniver Padron

records.addlTxt:
Case Called: 9:13 am
INCLUDES 22CM360 & 22CM528.
Clerk: Kassidi.
State appears by ADA Davis Runde in person:
Defendant appears in person, in custody, and with Atty Anne Renc in person;
VRCW. Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. State moves to:
22CM360:
Ct. 1 (Disorderly Conduct-Repeater-Domestic Abuse)>>DRI.

22CM528:
Ct. 1 (Criminal Damage to Property-Repeater-Domestic Abuse)>> DRI.

COURT GRANTS ABOVE.

PLEA: 
22CM528:
Ct. 2 (Disorderly Conduct-Repeater-Domestic Abuse)>> NO CONTEST.
Ct. 3 (BJ-Repeater-Domestic Abuse Assessments)>>NO CONTEST.

Crt advises def of rights & penalties & ques def to understanding.  Crt finds plea & waiver freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.  

COURT ORDERS: 
22CM528:
Ct. 2 (Disorderly Conduct-Repeater-Domestic Abuse)>> Sentence W/H- 18 Months Probation, Concurrent. CONDITIONS: Assessment/treatment/counseling as recommended, SAFE Program and Follow up, AODA and Follow up, Absolute Sobriety, Maintain Full time work/Full time school or a combination and when not fully engaged must complete 9 Hours of Community Service per week, No Contact with Victim unless approved by agent, Participate with the Marathon County Probation Review Hearings, I/S 60 Days MCJ to be used for rule violations, I/S 60 Hours of Community Service to be used for rule violations, Court Costs, DNA Sample and DNA Surcharge and Domestic Abuse Surcharge. Court finds 0 Days Credit.

Ct. 3 (BJ-Repeater-Domestic Abuse Assessments)>> Sentence W/H- 18 Months Probation, Concurrent. CONDITIONS: Assessment/treatment/counseling as recommended, SAFE Program and Follow up, AODA and Follow up, Absolute Sobriety, Maintain Full time work/Full time school or a combination and when not fully engaged must complete 9 Hours of Community Service per week, No Contact with Victim unless approved by agent, Participate with the Marathon County Probation Review Hearings, I/S 60 Days MCJ to be used for rule violations, I/S 60 Hours of Community Service to be used for rule violations, Court Costs, DNA Sample and DNA Surcharge and Domestic Abuse Surcharge. Court finds 0 Days Credit.

DATES:
Probation Review Hearing (22CM528) 09/16/2022 @ 1:15 pm

Adjourned: 9:31 am

offer done; discovery to be sent
future dates to remain
